statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -12 \\ -2 \\ -20 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -26 \\ 36 \\ 8 \\ 68 \\ 42 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] are or are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -1 \\ 0 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ 4 \\ 0 \\ 4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 8 \\ -12 \\ -2 \\ -20 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -26 \\ 36 \\ 8 \\ 68 \\ 42 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ -2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] are not a basis of \mathbb{R}^5.
